titleStmt.title: James Artman et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG9038

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
To his Excellency James F Robinson
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioners, being Jurors, officers of the Campbell Circuit Court, and others would respectfully represent that at the Febuary term 1862 ^of said court^ James Johnson was put upon trial under an indictment charging him with being accessory to the crime of another having counterfeit money in possession with intent to pass the same &c. That the verdict of the Jury was against him and he was adjudged to confinemet in the Penitentiary for two years and that he is now suffering that penalty,

Your petitioners would state that sd Johnson is an old man with a family ^consists^ of his wife and several children, That the proof though considered strong enough to him guilty authorize the verdict against him was not of conclusive against him,

In consideration of his age, and of the wants and condition of his family who we understand to be desirous to move to ^the state of^ Pennsylvania and of the possibility of his being innocent of the charge the undersigned would most earnestly but respectfully urge upon the exercise of executive clemancy in his case and grant his pardon and restoration to liberty.

Jas Artman Clk C. C. Ct
W I, Berry Atty
J Berry Atty

Joseph Eichelberger
Tho McGideor Juror
Thos Shinks
Abram Garrison
Henry Shrimp
Jas Haner
F Null
G W Gay
Jas H. Peters
John Kents } Jurors

H. M. Webster Attoy
Geo R Fearnons Atty at Law
J, B, Payne J, P, C, C
J. Hawthorn
H E Spilman (Deputy Sherriff)
C. W. Kavanaugh Atto
Ira Root Attorney at law

Jno,, C,, Mead
Sam Moore
Henry Wendt
J. C. D. Geode
Jno C Thomas } City Councilman
No good reason observed for pardon in this case
